dir.description:
**What is <dir>?** It's just how I call the endpoint of a directory. Many commands require <dir> in order to use audio or files, and you can use this command to browse directories for <dir>, and files.
For `browsing_mode`, we have two options:
`path` - Command will return directories only
`file` - Command will return directories and files they contain
dir.note:
| `root_directory` - `music`=Music. `audio`=voice clips and meme sounds and stuff.
| `browse_mode` - path | file 
`your_path` - path

cli.description:
**3 main features**
+ Play a random *sound* or *voice* of a specific keyword (e.g. `moan`, `gig`, `meme error`)
+ Play a random short speech of a specific given character name plus *as* (e.g. tohsaka=`astohsaka`, illya=`asillya`)
+ Play audio
cli.syntax: `-cli [keyword]=[sub-keyword]` or `-cli playpath [your_path_plus_filename]` e.g. *-cli gig* or *-cli meme=error*
cli.note:
| `keyword``sub-keyword` - Keyword is the <dir>, sub-keyword (meme only) is a file's *name* in that <dir>. If you don't know about <dir>, check cmd `dir`'s help.
Keywords: `gig``hen``moan``ohaiyo``konichiwa` etc.
| `your_path` - path with file name (e.g. path1\path2\a.mp3)

yolo.description: Repeat all audio files in a <dir>
yolo.note: `<dir>` - Check cmd `dir`'s help for more info

join.description: Summon the bot to the voice channel you're in

leave.description: Shoo the bot off the voice channel

hen.description:
NSFW images, with a tiny reaction added so that you can turn image easily.
There are four libraries you can choose: [bdsm], [bestiality], [milking], [mix].
hen.note: If no `tag`'s passed, cli will pick the *default* tag.

nhen.description: NSFW images, with a tiny reaction added so that you can turn image easily. Tag required

dhen.description:
**Danbooru's NSFWs**. Return an image with given tag, which will be deleted after 60s. Three little reactions is provided:
:arrow_forward: Switch image
:page_facing_up: Get the image's tags
:lock: | :unlock: Freeze the image for 420 secs (7 mins)
Other Danbooru's relevant commands: `-ddfadd` `-ddfremove` `drelevant`
dhen.note: `tag1` `tag2` - Spaceless tags (maximum 2). If omitted, cli will use the default tags. You can change default tags by `-ddfadd`, `-ddfremove`

ddfadd.description: Add tags to the default tags list
ddfadd.note: `tag1` `tag2` - Spaceless tags (maximum 2). If omitted, cli will show the default tags list

ddfremove.description: Remove tags from the default tags list
ddfremove.note: `tag1` `tag2` - Spaceless tags (maximum 2). If omitted, cli will show the default tags list.

drelevant.description: Find tags that are relevant to the given tag

nsfw.description:
So here we are, another NSFW stupid function. I'll make it as short as possible.
There are 3 commands: `-hen`, `-nhen` and `-dhen`. Then, what's the difference?
 `-hen` - Use offline resources, or we can say, *my* resources. I can proudly say this will surely satisfy you all, though the amount's quite limited (~200/lib)
 `-dhen` - This command, or group of commands (`-help` it for more info), use Danbooru's resources, and we all know its reputation right? Then why wouldn't I go there and fap, you must wonder. Well, you can't turn page on Danbooru, now you can with this. This alone is something, right? The rest I'll leave it to you.
 `-nhen` - This is the worst, just a bunch of nsfw-ecchi stuff of *kemonomimi*. If you want some vanilla thing, this could make it.
nsfw.syntax: Just want to add something. In order to use NSFW related cmds, you'll need to enable NSFW_mode, using this `-setting nsfw on`.

game.description:
Yeah you heard it. Games! *Text-based* games, sounds boring heh :joy: Currently we have two simple games commands, `-guess` and `-ttt`.
+ `-ttt` - Tic tac toe. This is just some homework thing for my teacher so don't put so much expectation on it :joy:
+ `-guess` - QUIZ GAME! This commands group is divided into three kinds: *All*, *Server-only* and *Creator-only* (yes, me).
*All* - Everyone can use it, add new ones, remove one's quiz, and view one's quizes [`-guess_all`]
*Server-only* - Only members of a server can use its quizes, add new ones by *All*-add in __that__ server (using `-guess_add_all`), and remove one's quizes [`-guess_ser`]
*Creator-only* - Everyone can use it, but no one can edit/remove/view it except me. [`-guess`]
game.note: Points are also provided, but applied only to `-guess`. The rest, meh.

guess.description:
Image quizes or text quizes. 
Hints are provided. 
Timeout is 15s. 
Reward points, if lose, **minus** one.

guess_all.description:
Everyone's image quizes or text quizes. 
Hints are provided. 
Timeout is 15s. 
No reward, no minus.

guess_ser.description:
Server's image quizes or text quizes. 
Hints are provided. 
Timeout is 15s. 
No reward, no minus.

guesses_all.description: Return a list of quizes you created and some info.

guesses_add_all.description: Return a list of quizes you created and some info.
guesses_add_all.note:
`question` - The question you want to ask
 `answer` - The answer (not case-sensitive, space allowed)
 `img_link`: The image's link. Note that `example.com//image1*.png*`, not `example.com//image1`

settings.description: View all settings and their values

custom_speech.description:
**Custom speech**... 
Long story short, it's a tagging system without command. You type 'hello', Cli responds 'yo dude'. You can set how Cli responds, delete the entry/response pair and view a list of entry/response pair.
Remember, these are server-wide values, so you cannot set entry 'hello' in server A then use it in server B.

cp_add.description: Add a new pair of entry and response

cp_del.description: Delete an entry along with its response

cp_list.description: View all entries/responses of the server
